meanings.definition: Looking or sounding bizarre or unfamiliar.
meanings.sent1: The outlandish costume at the party caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: Her outlandish hairstyle made her stand out in the crowd.
meanings.sent3: He wore an outlandish hat that made people smile.
meanings.sent4: The outlandish idea of living on Mars seemed intriguing.
meanings.sent5: The outlandish painting was unlike anything I had ever seen before.

meanings.sent1: The outlandish price of the luxury car surprised the customers.
meanings.sent2: Their outlandish demands made negotiations difficult.
meanings.sent3: She received an outlandish amount of compliments on her cooking.
meanings.sent4: The outlandish speed of the car left everyone in awe.
meanings.sent5: The outlandish size of the cake amazed the party guests.

meanings.definition: Of a person or their behavior, unconventional or eccentric.
meanings.sent1: His outlandish sense of humor always made us laugh.
meanings.sent2: The outlandish dance moves entertained the audience.
meanings.sent3: She had an outlandish habit of collecting unusual rocks.
meanings.sent4: The outlandish personality of the artist shone through in their work.
meanings.sent5: The outlandish behavior of the cat kept the family amused.
